Compensation_MatrixObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Compensation_MatrixObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Compensation_MatrixObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: A reference to a current or new compensation matrix.

Compensation_Matrix_Data.description: The unique ID of this Compensation Matrix.
The effective date of this merit increase matrix.  If no date is provided, this will default to 1900-01-01.
The name of this Compensation Matrix. This will be displayed throughout the Workday system.
The description, including purpose and application, of this Compensation Matrix.

Review_Rating_ScaleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Review_Rating_ScaleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Compensation_Matrix_Data.description: The Rating Scale used by this Compensation Matrix.

validation.validation: Rating Scale may be inactive or not valid for Compensation Matrix.

Condition_RuleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Condition_RuleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Condition_RuleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Compensation_Matrix_Non-weighted_Percent.description: Specifying a target rule means that the merit increase matrix (MIM) only applies to employees that fall within that target rule.  Specifying two or more target rules results in multiple-target MIMs with target ranges applicable to those employees that fall within the target rule.  Leaving the Target Rule Reference empty will result in a single-target MIM that can be used for across the entire organization.

Condition_RuleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Compensation_Matrix_Entry_Percent_Based_.description: The condition rules for this Compensation Matrix. Condition rules determine when the modifications defined in the matrix apply.

Compensation_Matrix_Entry_Amount_Based_D.description: The currency associated with the target rule for the minimum and maximum amount on the merit increase matrix.  If no value is specified, a default currency will be assigned provided the Default Currency exists on the parent element "MIM for Amount Bonus Plan Data".  Otherwise, you must enter a currency value.  Note:  For Single Target without any Target Rule, the currency is always set from the default currency.
